docs.text: Overview Example from dolib import Client client = Client ( token = "60c13d47***ed98dd9" ) droplet = client . droplets . all ()[ 0 ] print ( droplet ) #> Droplet(id=120794777, name='dolib-test', region=Region(fra1), #> size=Size(s-2vcpu-4gb), image=Image('18.04 x64'), ....) volume = client . volumes . get ( "53cf7120-9d5b-11ea-aed1-0a58ac14d008" ) client . volumes . attach ( volume , droplet_id = droplet . id )
docs.title: Overview

docs.text: from dolib import Client client = Client ( token = "60c13d47***ed98dd9" ) droplet = client . droplets . all ()[ 0 ] print ( droplet ) #> Droplet(id=120794777, name='dolib-test', region=Region(fra1), #> size=Size(s-2vcpu-4gb), image=Image('18.04 x64'), ....) volume = client . volumes . get ( "53cf7120-9d5b-11ea-aed1-0a58ac14d008" ) client . volumes . attach ( volume , droplet_id = droplet . id )
docs.title: Example

docs.text: Easy install from PyPI: pip install dolib dolib required python 3.6, 3.7, 3.8, or 3.9, pydantic , and httpx
docs.title: Install

docs.text: DOLib provides sync and async clients.
docs.title: Client

docs.text: DOLib models it is a Pydantic models for all Digital Ocean API objects. Its simple to use this models in python context. from dolib.models import Droplet droplet = Droplet ( name = "dolib-test" , region = "fra1" , size = "s-1vcpu-1gb" , image = "ubuntu-20-04-x64" ) new_droplet = client . droplets . create ( droplet ) print ( new_droplet ) #> Droplet(id=243139176, # name='dolib-test', # region=Region(fra1), # size=Size(s-1vcpu-1gb), # image=Image(ubuntu-20-04-x64), # ssh_keys=None, # backups=None, # ipv6=None, # private_networking=None, # monitoring=None, # vpc_uuid=None, # user_data=None, # volumes=None, # tags=[], # memory=1024, # vcpus=1, # disk=25, # locked=False, # created_at=datetime.datetime(2021, 4, 25, 9, 52, 58, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), # status='new', # backup_ids=[], # snapshot_ids=[], # features=[], # size_slug='s-1vcpu-1gb', # networks=Networks(v4=[], v6=[]), # kernel=None, # next_backup_window=None, # volume_ids=[] # )
docs.title: Models
